abstracts.cdata!:
The Burkina Faso Urban Environmental
            Project had a satisfactory outcome, likely sustainability,
            high institutional development impact, and overall
            satisfactory Bank and Borrower performance. Among the
            lessons learned are these: 1) Continuity is key to long term
            development impact. 2) Reforming and improving local tax
            systems takes time and requires a long-term commitment that
            exceeds the lifetime of a project. 3) Privatizing solid
            waste management systems should be implemented by clearly
            defined steps and with continuous support. 4) Customer
            demand  and tariff structure explain the success of the
            sanitation program. 5) Community-based approaches were
            efficient in identifying sound investment programs and
            securing both capital and maintenance funds. 6) Housing
            finance is a product in high demand and giving imited
            support at the institutional level yields substantial
            results. 7) Linking capacity building to investment programs
            increases the incentive to improve urban management performance.
